title: Seven questions with Nathan Parkin
text:
What's a stock you want to own that you'd like to see get cheaper?

We have an underweight position in Westpac that has a relatively high dividend payout ratio and new regulatory standards on the way and as such the capital position, in our view, is tighter than other banks. An event that alleviates this pressure would be attractive.

Which side are you on in the reinvest versus returns debate sparked by the federal Treasurer?

If companies cannot find good opportunities to invest then returning capital to shareholders is prudent. That said, companies should remember that when no-one else is investing it might be the best time to put capital to work.

Give us an example of how your ESG process has protected you from proverbial landmines?

We try to look for ethical and sustainability issues before they are reflected in a company’s share price. For example our analysts removed IOOF from our investible stock universe on governance concerns prior to the share price decline and also proactively removed some aged care stocks due to a lack of policies around human rights.

We're always looking for TV shows to stream. Anything new or old that's caught your eye?

Elementary is a modern Sherlock Homes series set in New York. Quite enjoyable for inquisitive people.

Finally, a recommendation for the readers on a good value quick bite in [Sydney].

Portal at No.1 Martin Place is good food and for a good cause, giving 100 per cent of profit to charity.
description: AFR Markets Live chats to the Ethical Partners investment director about the best time to put capital to work and the opportunity he sees in Graincorp shares.
